title: Introduction
code: WirbelJ_2018 #> phyloseq-class experiment-level object #> otu_table()   OTU Table:         [ 530 taxa and 125 samples ] #> sample_data() Sample Data:       [ 125 samples by 137 sample variables ] #> tax_table()   Taxonomy Table:    [ 530 taxa by 6 taxonomic ranks ] #> phy_tree()    Phylogenetic Tree: [ 530 tips and 529 internal nodes ] table(sample_data(WirbelJ_2018)$disease) #>  #>     CRC healthy  #>      60      65

what: Dysbiosis score based on median community level variation
title: Introduction
text: Calculates median variation given sample compared reference sample group. calculate median variation sample compared reference sample set. user can provide custom distance matrix. user provides Bray-Curtis dissimilarity matrix, resulting score comparable ‘dysbiosis score’ reported Lloyd-Price J, Arze C, Ananthakrishnan et al. (2019)
code: dist.mat <- phyloseq::distance(WirbelJ_2018, "bray") ref.samples <- rownames(meta(subset_samples(WirbelJ_2018, disease == "healthy"))) dysbiosis_1 <- dysbiosisMedianCLV(WirbelJ_2018,                                   dist_mat = dist.mat,                                   reference_samples = ref.samples) dysbiosis_1 |>    ggplot(aes(disease,score, color=disease)) +   geom_boxplot(width = 0.3, show.legend = FALSE)+   geom_jitter(width = 0.1, show.legend = FALSE) +   theme_bw()+   scale_color_manual(values = c(CRC="brown3", healthy ="steelblue")) +   labs(x="", y="Dysbiosis Score")

what: Cloud-based LOcally linear Unbiased Dysbiosis (CLOUD) test
title: Introduction
text: Cloud-based LOcally linear Unbiased Dysbiosis (CLOUD) test non-parametric test returns measure dysbiosis. function adapted original article Montassier E et al. 2018. , user defines set reference samples distance every sample calculated. important aspect note function method slightly modified accommodate equal number samples reference test group. calculating stats reference samples number neighbors defined number reference samples minus 1. test samples, number test samples matches number samples reference group, number neighbors also defined number reference samples minus 1. done avoid returning NAs outputs retaining maximum number reference samples. , log2Stats can used dysbiosis score.
code: cloud.results <- cloudStatistic(WirbelJ_2018,                                 dist_mat = dist.mat,                                 reference_samples = ref.samples,                                 ndim=-1) cloud.results[1:3,1:5] #>                    stats    pvals            ids   log2Stats   study_name #> MMPU29365221ST 1.0186169 0.343750 MMPU29365221ST  0.02661160 WirbelJ_2018 #> MMPU68403337ST 0.9591212 0.625000 MMPU68403337ST -0.06021501 WirbelJ_2018 #> MMPU72854103ST 0.9914070 0.484375 MMPU72854103ST -0.01245058 WirbelJ_2018 cloud.results |>    ggplot(aes(disease, log2Stats, color=disease)) +   geom_boxplot(width = 0.3, show.legend = FALSE)+   geom_jitter(width = 0.1, show.legend = FALSE) +   theme_bw()+   scale_color_manual(values = c(CRC="brown3", healthy ="steelblue")) +   labs(x="", y="Dysbiosis CLOUD Score") #> Warning: Removed 60 rows containing non-finite values (stat_boxplot). #> Warning: Removed 60 rows containing missing values (geom_point).

what: Dysbiosis score based on Euclidean distance to group centroids
title: Introduction
text: Calculates difference euclidean distance (ED) sample group centroids. example, sample_1 control centroid minus sample_1 case centroid. user can provide custom distance matrix. approach used AlShawaqfeh MK et al. (2017). , CentroidDist_score can used dysbiosis score.
code: dysbiosis_2 <- euclideanDistCentroids(WirbelJ_2018,                                       dist_mat = dist.mat,                                       use_squared = TRUE,                                       group_col = "disease",                                       control_label = "healthy",                                       case_label = "CRC") dysbiosis_2[1:3,1:3] #>                     CentroidDist_CRC CentroidDist_healthy CentroidDist_score #> CCMD11006829ST-21-0        0.2912347            0.3684569         0.07722225 #> CCMD12232071ST-21-0        0.2744104            0.3415175         0.06710710 #> CCMD13071240ST-21-0        0.2172320            0.2697302         0.05249821 dysbiosis_2 |>    ggplot(aes(disease, CentroidDist_score, color=disease)) +   geom_boxplot(width = 0.3, show.legend = FALSE)+   geom_jitter(width = 0.1, show.legend = FALSE) +   theme_bw()+   scale_color_manual(values = c(CRC="brown3", healthy ="steelblue")) +   labs(x="", y="Dysbiosis CLOUD Score") title: Cloud-based LOcally linear Unbiased Dysbiosis (CLOUD) test — cloudStatistic
code: data("WirbelJ_2018") library(phyloseq) ps <- WirbelJ_2018 # Define controls as reference samples ref.samples <- rownames(meta(subset_samples(ps, disease == "healthy"))) dist.data <- phyloseq::distance(ps, "bray") cloud.results <- cloudStatistic(ps,                                 dist_mat = dist.data,                                 reference_samples = ref.samples, title: Dysbiosis Score Based on Median Community Level Variation — dysbiosisMedianCLV
text: Calculates median variation given sample compared reference          sample group. dysbiosisMedianCLV calculate median          variation sample compared reference sample set. user          can provide custom distance matrix. user provides Bray-Curtis          dissimilarity matrix, resulting score comparable          dysbiosis score reported          Lloyd-Price J, Arze C, Ananthakrishnan et al. (2019).

title: Dysbiosis Score Based on Euclidean Distance to Group Centroids — euclideanDistCentroids
text: Dysbiosis Score Based Euclidean Distance Group Centroids

title: Dysbiosis Score Based on Euclidean Distance to Group Centroids — euclideanDistCentroids
text: x phyloseq object dist_mat distance matrix. Can output phyloseq::distance vegan::vegdist. use_squared Logical. Default FALSE. TURE score calculated using squared distance group centroids. see usedist::dist_to_centroids. group_col column phyloseq::sample_data control case labels. control_label character string specifying control/healthy labels group_col. case_label character string specifying case/disease labels group_col.

title: Dysbiosis Score Based on Euclidean Distance to Group Centroids — euclideanDistCentroids
text: data frame Centroid distance group score         sample information

title: Dysbiosis Score Based on Euclidean Distance to Group Centroids — euclideanDistCentroids
text: Calculates difference euclidean distance (ED) sample          group centroids. example, sample_1 control centroid minus          sample_1 case centroid. user can provide custom distance          matrix. approach used AlShawaqfeh MK et al. (2017).

title: Dysbiosis Score Based on Euclidean Distance to Group Centroids — euclideanDistCentroids
text: AlShawaqfeh MK et al. (2017). dysbiosis index assess microbial changes fecal samples dogs chronic inflammatory enteropathy. FEMS microbiology ecology, 93(11), p.fix136.

title: Dysbiosis Score Based on Euclidean Distance to Group Centroids — euclideanDistCentroids
